intro: Daviesia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It is an erect shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with flowers appearing in late summer to autumn. Daviesia longifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
